author: Pedro Teixeira
comment: Time estimate to battery drain is currently -364 days... Not sure that's what I want. Otherwise, love the prediction for how much longer you have, although I wish it would also say how long the watch has already been on, or even better an estimate of how much total time you should get while unplugged. With that you can compare days and quickly determine if a new app or setting is significantly impacting battery life. Will return to 5 stars once bug is fixed.
title: Awesome, but with weird bugs

author: Afram Kirmiz
comment: No disrespect to the developer(s), but the app doesn't really give granularity to what is using your battery.  It's not really that much more useful than the battery info you get in the wear app.  If you're looking for what is causing battery drain, all this seems to tell you is what applications you have installed, not how much battery is being used by each app or process.
title: Expected more, not much use. Paid for one of the non-free versions and expected a bit more

author: William Aung Leyraud
comment: I'd like to see more details just like the battery information for the phone where it shows which app consumed more battery in % and how long each app was running individually. In such way we can determine which app is misbehaving/battery hugging. Please keep on the good work, I'd love to give 5 stars for this app.
title: Very promising app.

author: Mike Turley
comment: Knowing the time until a battery is empty is a vital thing, especially on a small battery such as a smartwatch.  The graph and rate of decline is interesting too, but I'd give a 5th star to this review if I could configure this thing to show the "fully discharged in X hours" message immediately when I launch it, it would reduce me to using one awkward screen press to view that info from my watchface instead of two.
title: Simple and perfect little nugget of helpful and important info.

author: Dominic Lotters
comment: Would love if it could show what's using the battery. The native Android Wear app gives a useful breakdown that this app seems to be missing. For instance, how much has Bluetooth consumed? How much has the heart rate monitor consumed, etc
title: It's OK, could be better

author: benodiktine
comment: All I'm really looking for is a widget for my phone that tells me my Android Wear watch's battery percentage. I don't like that I have to open up the app just to see that. Overall good, worth checking out.
title: Needs a Widget

author: Maxx Rodriguez
comment: Desperately needs improvement. Sometimes my watch battery will drain a lot over night, but I cannot figure out why with this app. This app is practically just graph of your battery life. It rarely ever shows app activity. Edit: noticed it hasn't been updated since December of last year. What a shame.
title: Needs improvement.

author: Joe Stewart
comment: Great app. Does what it's supposed to. Two suggestions. 1:I would like to see a little more data on what's using power. 2: I would like to be able to notify on more parameters, like time and power level. Even if the drain is more than a certain percent an hour or something. Thanks!
title: Like it

comment: that need some more features to make it into the 5 star category. Most important an analyzer for which he app eats up how much power. Similar to the battery stats on the phone. But so far it's not bad and I hope it will receive further development.
title: A good app,

author: Richard Field
comment: Nice work! The app looks great. Here's an idea...... In view of the random battery drain on Android lollipop, how about adding a feature when the app notices a rapid increase in battery use. A vibration alarm could then prompt the user to restart the watch - an action which temporarily fixes the problem. This would make your app an essential one for long suffering lollipop users. It's just an idea. You're welcome!
title: Good app

author: James DiBernardo
comment: But it would be nice if the app reported which apps on the watch are using more battery than others. Moto 360 (gen1) ...maybe it supposed to, mine isant saying that.
title: Does what it says.

author: Simon Philpott
comment: It used to work until I connected a second wear device. Even after uninstalling the app from one of the watches that app fails to connect to the app on the watch and show stats.

author: Richard Lansdowne
comment: This is great for viewing and predicting your battery life. You can view it on both phone and watch.  Since android wear (really annoyingly) deleted this from the app this has become an essential app. I don't see too much information on the apps usage on the watch but that no biggie. Once I got used to wearing an android watch every day for a few months I tend to use apps fairly rarely hence I always have almost 2 days predicted on battery life.
title: Essential since native app dropped this

author: Drew Mast
comment: Says "fully charged - just now" - but also says 86% charged, on the very same screen. Otherwise I like the app. I've had it maybe 36 hours.
title: Charging ETA and battery percentage don't match

author: Gina Yashere
comment: I thought it would tell me which apps are consuming what amount of battery power. It doesn't. Not sure what this does any different from the native android wear battery app. I want my 99c back
title: Not much info

author: Rand Sherman
comment: It would be great if I could alert on the rate of battery discharge. Sometimes the watch battery drains too quickly and you want to alert on that rather than wait for it to get to 50%.
title: Works just as expected

author: Mark Tadong
comment: Good of you want to know if there's a sudden or ongoing battery drain without needing to open the phone app. Does not seem to have any impact on the battery either. Battery time prediction not very accurate, too generous.
title: Great

author: Rico Vee
comment: Let's me see how I did for the day, how long I can run and if I'm getting odd draining behavior from a new app. Cool.
title: Simple

author: Vincent McGarry
comment: Hi, I like this app with my Verizon S5 & Sony Smart watch 3. So I donated but app seems no different.  How do I enable the unlocked features?
title: Donated but how do I unlock app?

author: Spencer Gaston
comment: Connecting to watch but application is unreachable. I've waited a minute and resynced apps, would love to try out this app.
title: Samsung Gear Live

author: Travis Chavis
comment: I tried for a week with my new Motor 360 and it didn't show the the apps that were actually causing the battery to drain
title: Didn't display battery draining apps

author: Chun-Kid Leung
comment: It was working fine until I factory reset watch. Now no longer syncs or see watch. Waste of donation
title: No longer connects

author: Will E. Wonty
comment: As was mentioned in an earlier review, I also have no figures on the time axis along the bottom of the graph (neither on the phone nor the watch) - it is difficult to use the app until this is fixed.
title: No figures on time axis

author: rafa -
comment: This app is very apropriate since the stock Android Wear provides limited functionallity. The app would be a kick-ass-five-star app if: (1) There is a widget (2) If you could set the Threshold type to a specific value for "% per hour" instead of a threshold for absolute level of the remaining battery level. (This would be so so so kick-ass).  Thanks!
title: Innovative! good job

author: Thomas Howard
comment: I was really hoping it would help me determine why, on some days, my battery drains from 100% to nothing in just a few hours while other days it lasts all day. It doesn't show any information on what apps are running or how much battery their using. Aside from giving an estimate of how much time is left on the battery, it doesn't do much.

author: Kerry Ling
comment: After updating Android Wear from 1.3 to 1.4. Found that the battery status display was removed in 1.4. Everybody were complianing about that online. I even uninstalled 1.4 from and phone, downloaded and installed 1.3 back. And then I found this app Wear Battery Stats. It displays battery status just like how 1.3 Android Wear does it and more. Now i just use this app along with which ever latest Android Wear version. 5 stars to Wear Battery Stats
title: Great replacement for Android wear 1.3 battery status

author: Lucas Kara
comment: I purchased the battery watchface, and it said in the wear battery app that it has been unlocked, but I can't seem to activate the time threshold notification, only the percentage one...can you not use the time left activation type when your using the watchface? Or is this a bug? I'm not sure. Great apps tho. :)
title: Good app

author: alison adams
comment: This also works on the Ticwatch E. Like others have mentioned, what I need most of all is a widget to display watch battery % on my phone home screen. Something visible without having to open an app first. That, I would happily pay for.

author: Seza Tas
comment: It would be much more useful to see apps' % battery usage data instead of 'update' info which is not so practical to know.
title: Nice but needs improvement

comment: Hello I have donated last week but the full features were not unlocked. Please fix and then I'll give you 5 stars. Thanks you
title: Features not unlocked

author: Ryan Ballard
comment: Needs compatibility with Wear 2.0. It's not showing up on my Gen 1 Urbane.

author: Михаил Турусов
comment: It needs a support for several devices. I have 2 watches I cycle between. App can team input one at phone. Also, predictions are not precise enough, and approximate the whole graph, not only the last part.

author: d. hatch
comment: How do I get a notification on the phone when the watch battery goes below what I set it to? I donated & it only showed on the watch - if I'm already looking at the watch I can just check the battery there without your notification...
title: Notification on the phone?

author: Alejandro Moulier Piñero
comment: Somehow stopped showing app in the "app activities" area.  Whitout that the app become useless.
title: Do not show apps

author: nascent nascentt
comment: Doesn't give any app drain info.
title: "No app activity " moto 360

author: Lema Cices
comment: It says -363 days left to discharge. Possibly a date related bug. Another bug, the app kind of looses the connection sometimes. This only happens twice with the latest Android update to watch and the wear app. Other than that everything is great.
title: Bugs

comment: Not sure is this is working for me. Getting a graph similar to the Android wear app, but I'm not getting app usage details, was hoping to see how much my heart rate tracker uses, but no apps are showing usage
title: Working or not?

author: Janis Froehlig
comment: The only help I get is an estimate of how long my battery might last, and that Google updates suck. I know all that already.
title: It's not telling me what's eating the juice

author: David Forslund
comment: I just trtied installing this on my S6 Edge for use with my Sony Smartwatch 3.  It isn't listed as being compatible but it did finally work.  I had to wait a long time for it to sync up with the watch.   I've only used it a short while so far, but I do seem to be getting some history.   I just installed this as the latest Android Wear update (11/11/15) seems to have removed the battery stats from the options.   Since I've had problems with the rapid battery drain, I want to keep an eye on the battery to see if it recurs before the battery drains to zero.  We'll see if this app actually replaces the battery display in android wear.

author: Mark Ellis
comment: Just mirrors battery on the wear apps, i braught to show what apps were zapping my battery, and it didn't.
